title: myEye2Wheeler: A Two-Wheeler Indian Driver Real-World Eye-Tracking Dataset
author: Bhaiya Vaibhaw Kumar, Deepti Rawat, Tanvi Kandalla, Aarnav Nagariya, Kavita Vemuri
relevance_why: The insights into gaze behavior and the need for context-specific models can inform the development of innovations in audio-visual integration in driving assistance systems.
background: Collecting eye-tracking data from two-wheeler drivers navigating complex traffic conditions in India to analyze visual attention and decision-making.
contribution: This paper introduces a comprehensive dataset for two-wheeler driving in Indian traffic to solve the lack of specific behavioral studies, achieving substantial gaze data across diverse driving scenarios.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing datasets primarily focus on four-wheelers or stationary setups, limiting insights into real-world two-wheeler dynamics.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work captures dynamic two-wheeler driving environments, providing gaze data that reflects the unique complexities faced by drivers in Indian traffic conditions.

key_innovation: The dataset includes variations in traffic scenarios and unpackages the challenges two-wheeler drivers encounter, emphasizing real-world applicability.
real_world_impact: This dataset can enhance understanding of two-wheeler driver behavior, contributing to improved safety measures and the development of tailored driver assistance technologies.
limitations: Data was collected only during specific hours under uniform lighting conditions, which may not reflect broader driving contexts.

new_terms.saliency models: **Saliency models** are computational approaches that predict areas of interest in visual scenes based on human gaze data, aiming to understand attention allocation during tasks like driving.

open_sourcing: Data will be released in formats suitable for varied research applications with measures for participant anonymity.
